NAME: Manisha Dhingra
ABOUT:
Data scientist with a coding background and a demonstrated history of working in a customer-first B2C company. 

My current area of focus is unraveling consumer behavior in retail/e-commerce using the ever-evolving suite of ML/statistical models and empowering the business by building such insight generating data science products.

EDUCATION.Institute Name: Birla Institute of Technology and Science

LICENSES & CERTIFICATION.Name: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization and Optimization

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Demographic and Social analysis for personalization in e-commerce
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: A lot of factors influence an online purchase for a visitor. Certain features like affordability, interests, sentient and requirements can be a key factor in targeting a user better. Such information is not explicitly available but can be inferred to an extent from the information available about the user. We have used third party tools and API’s to collect more of such demographic and social information about the user. Not only this information can be used to provide more personalized and efficient targeting, it can also be used to find trends in the data for better marketing. Exploratory analysis shows that the gathered data will lead to better predictive models for personalization.
Created a web mashup using Google Maps Javascript API and crime database of India. Used AJAX to retrieve and display the data asynchronously.

We developed a GUI for a VOIP application on a platform Qt. To achieve this we used concepts of Network Programming in C. This gave a very good hands on experience with socket programming and a very good familiarity with Qt.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Assignment solving and submission on a Virtual Machine and management of the Virtual Machine Server
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Development of a PHP-MySQL based client interface to connect to the Virtual Machine from the browser with all the security related issues to prevent plagiarism and management of the Virtual Machine Server (Installation, Creation of VM templates, Cloning of VMs, assigning VMs to a group, submitting VMs, revoking access to the VMs etc).
I worked with the back-end, i.e the management of virtual machines management. Thus,it gave me a good hands on experience with the virtual machines and virtual servers.
Most part of my work was managing the XEN server, and integrating it with the front end,i.e PHP-SQL based client using scripts.
